text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!
I got so many requests from you guys
to make something from Shadow Hunters.

I love the series, so whether you are a fan
of the books,

the movie, or the TV series that is out right now,
I have got a fun recipe!

I wanted to make some homemade chocolate cookies,
and decorate them with the different runes.

If you’re not familiar with the runes, they
are magical markings that give you special

abilities, and there are a ton of them, in
the story!

Like heal, deflect, night vision, cool stuff
like that!

So today we are gonna be making Shadow Hunter
Cookies, decorated with the different Runes!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 1-1/2 cups
of sugar, 1 cup of unsalted butter, 1/2 a cup

of special dark cocoa powder, 2-1/2 cups of
all purpose flour, 2 eggs, 1/2 a teaspoon

of almond extract, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1
teaspoon of baking powder, and an 1/8th of a
teaspoon of salt.
Which is basically my pinch.

You will also need a circle cookie cutter,
mine is about 3 inches, and royal icing, white
and black.

I put them into plastic baggies with number
2 tips at the end.
Now let’s put it all together!

This recipe is an adaptation of my lemon sugar
cookie recipe in The Nerdy Nummies Cookbook,
but we’re going to make it chocolatey!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is whisk
together our dry ingredients in this bowl.

So you’re gonna add your flour, special
dark cocoa powder…
Oh yeah, the chocolate!

This is really important because it’s gonna
help us get that dark color that we want.
Yummy-yummy-yummy!
Some salt, and baking powder!

Then you’re gonna whisk together until it’s
well combined.

Now we’re gonna cream our butter
and sugar into a big mixing bowl.
Mix it together until it’s light and fluffy.

Once your butter is creamed, we are gonna
add our eggs, vanilla extract and almond extract.

Then we’re gonna mix it together until everything
is fully combined.

Now we’ve got our creamy mixture and our
dry mixture, and we are gonna add dry mixture to the

creamy in the big bowl, 1/2 at a time, because
this recipe is very dense, it’s very thick
cookie dough.
Doo-doo-doo-doo, just eyeball it.

And then mix it up, and then add the other
1/2, and then

mix it up! Our chocolate cookie dough is ready,
and now we’ve gotta wrap it up tight because

it’s gonna chill in the fridge for 30 to
45 minutes.
You’re gonna take a….
Ssssshhhhhhoooot!

You’re just gonna take a little piece of
plastic wrap, pick up your dough.
Oh you yummy chocolate ball, come here!
Wrap it up tight.

Now you’re gonna pop this in the fridge
for 30-45 minutes to chill and to get firm.

Once your dough is chilled, we are gonna roll
it out.

First I’m gonna dust the work surface so
that our dough doesn’t stick.

And, oh my gosh, cool tip you guys, you can
use cocoa powder when you’re making chocolate cookies,
so you won’t get white flour all over it.
Oh you guys, this is really cool, this is like the beginning of the story.

Clary just starts drawing this shape all the
time, and she doesn’t know why.
Shje’s like, “why am I drawing this shape?”
And she doesn’t know!

But she can’t remember because her mom wiped
her memory!

This is just really an excuse for me to play
with chocolate all day.
I got a good trick for this…

So you just grab one end, you open it and
you just pull it.
You just rip it!
Yeah.
Works every time!

This is a lot of dough, so I’m gonna roll
1/2 of it out at a time.

Our chocolate cookie dough is all rolled out,
and now we’re gonna cut out our cookies.

You’re gonna take your circle cookie cutter,
and just cut out as many as you can!

Now remove the excess cookie dough, I’m
gonna place it over here, to re-roll it and
make some more cookies.

And we’re gonna pick up your cookies, place
them on top of your baking

sheet, I’ve lined them with a piece of parchment
paper so that they don’t stick to the bottom
while they’re baking.

Now it’s time to bake these cookies, you’re
gonna heat your oven to
325 and bake for about 16 minutes!

Once your cookies have baked and had plenty
of time to cool, it’s my favorite part,
it's time to decorate!

We’re gonna be decorating these cookies
using royal icing.
We’re first gonna
be starting with our white royal icing.

Again, I just put some into a plastic baggie,
with a
number 2 tip for a little bit more control.

The first step is we are going to outline
with your royal icing.

Now that we’ve got all of our cookies outlined,
now we are gonna flood them with royal icing.

This is really cool because your outline acts
as a fence to keep all that yummy icing in there.

Then you’re just gonna take a toothpick
to smooth it out.

Once  you’ve got your cookies iced, now
we’re gonna let them set for 1 hour, at
room temperature, just to let them dry and set.

And while they’re setting, we are gonna
design
some runes!

So, here are the runes that I’m gonna be
using, I picked my favorite.

I made a template in Photoshop, I’ll put
a link down below if you’d like to use the
same template.

But, you can also make your own, you can choose
any of your own runes.
There are tons of them!

So what you’re gonna do is tape your paper
down, I put mine on top of a cutting board so
I could lift it, move it around.

And then tape a piece of wax paper right on
top of it.

Then you’re gonna take your black royal
icing, again I put it into a plastic baggie with

a number 2 tip at the end, for a little bit
more control.
And, we’re gonna pipe the designs.

I like to outline the shape and then fill
it in.
Again, you can use toothpicks to adjust
the royal icing.

After you’ve piped your runes, now you’re
gonna let them set out for a
very long time!

Sometimes I like to make these designs the
day before I’ll need ‘em.

Or make them in the morning, and then they’re
ready to go at night.

You’re gonna let them sit at room temperature
for 8-12 hours.
This is really important,

you want them to be completely dry before
you pick them up and transfer them.
They’re very delicate.

I wish I had a rune for dry because I could
just go insta!
But I can’t…
I’m just a mundane…

Now our cookies are ready, our runes are ready,
and we are going to assemble them!

Remember when you’re making designs with
royal icing, they’re very fragile, so it’s
a good idea to make some extra.

And, if they break, you can just stick them
back together, that’s OK!

To get these off the wax paper, I like to
pull them to the edge of the counter, then

I use a knife to get underneath them, kind of like
a spatula!

Oh my gosh you guys, it worked, it worked,
it worked!

And gently place it on top of your cookie,
then do this to the rest of your cookies.
Ta-da!

Here are the Shadow Hunter themed cookies
that we made today, they look so good!

A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
these!
These are some of my favorite runes, but you
can make whatever you’d like.

And, a little trick, is I took a little bit
of royal icing

and I dabbed it on the back of our design
so you can pick ‘em up and they wouldn’t
fall, look at that!
Dee-doo-da-doo-doo!

I’ll be taking lots of pictures of these
and posting them on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram

and Tumblr, and if you guys make these, please
take a picture and send it to me!

I just love seeing your baking creations,
I get a big kick out of it.

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Oh, and I have a taste test for me!

I’m gonna do the angelic power, because
it’s the most iconic.
Huuuhhhh!
Mmmm-mmmmm!
Mmmmm-mmmmm-mmmmm-mmmmm-MMMMMMM!
